statements: SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, wage FROM payroll_data WHERE hours_worked > 40;
SELECT employee_id, pay_period_start, pay_period_end FROM payroll_data ORDER BY pay_period_start DESC;
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE wage >= 5000 ORDER BY wage DESC, pay_period_end ASC;
SELECT employee_name, SUM(hours_worked) AS total_hours_worked FROM payroll_data GROUP BY employee_name;
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE employee_id = 1
SELECT employee_name, wage FROM payroll_data ORDER BY wage DESC
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE hours_worked > 40 AND wage > 20 ORDER BY employee_id ASC
SELECT employee_name, SUM(wage) AS total_wages FROM payroll_data GROUP BY employee_name HAVING total_wages > 1000
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, DATE_ADD(pay_period_start, INTERVAL 1 WEEK) AS next_pay_start FROM payroll_data
SELECT * FROM payroll_data;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee_info ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT wage FROM payroll_data WHERE wage > 5000;
SELECT * FROM employee_info WHERE first_name LIKE 'J%';
SELECT first_name, last_name, payment_date FROM payroll_data ORDER BY payment_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM payroll_data;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee_info WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2020-01-01' AND '2021-01-01';
SELECT employee_id, wage FROM payroll_data WHERE wage > 5000 ORDER BY wage DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM employee_info ORDER BY last_name, first_name ASC;
SELECT p.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM payroll_data p INNER JOIN employee_info e ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE total_pay > 1000
SELECT employee_id, total_pay FROM payroll_data ORDER BY total_pay DESC
SELECT pay_date, hours_worked FROM payroll_data WHERE hourly_rate >= 15 AND hours_worked < 40
SELECT id, hourly_rate FROM payroll_data WHERE pay_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-01-31'
SELECT * FROM payroll_data LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE employee_id = 100 ORDER BY pay_date DESC, total_pay ASC
SELECT id, pay_date, total_pay FROM payroll_data WHERE hours_worked > 40 AND hourly_rate > 20 ORDER BY total_pay DESC
SELECT employee_id, SUM(total_pay) AS total_salary FROM payroll_data GROUP BY employee_id HAVING total_salary > 2000
SELECT * FROM payroll_data WHERE pay_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31' AND hourly_rate >= 15 ORDER BY pay_date ASC
SELECT employee_id, AVG(hours_worked) AS avg_hours FROM payroll_data GROUP BY employee_id HAVING avg_hours < 40
SELECT * FROM WageRecords;
SELECT employee_id, wage_amount, pay_date FROM WageRecords WHERE wage_amount > 5000;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, hire_date, job_title FROM EmployeeDetails ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, tax_amount, tax_date FROM TaxRecords WHERE tax_amount < 1000 ORDER BY tax_date ASC;
SELECT employee_id, leave_type, start_date, end_date FROM LeaveRecords WHERE leave_type = 'Sick Leave';
SELECT * FROM WageRecords WHERE wage_amount > 5000 ORDER BY pay_date DESC;
SELECT job_title, COUNT(employee_id) as num_employees FROM EmployeeDetails GROUP BY job_title HAVING num_employees > 1;
SELECT e.employee_name, t.tax_amount FROM EmployeeDetails e INNER JOIN TaxRecords t ON e.employee_id = t.employee_id WHERE t.tax_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT e.employee_name, l.leave_type, l.start_date, l.end_date FROM EmployeeDetails e INNER JOIN LeaveRecords l ON e.employee_id = l.employee_id ORDER BY l.start_date, l.end_date;

SELECT e.employee_name, w.wage_amount, t.tax_amount FROM EmployeeDetails e LEFT JOIN WageRecords w ON e.employee_id = w.employee_id LEFT JOIN TaxRecords t ON e.employee_id = t.employee_id WHERE w.wage_amount IS NOT NULL AND t.tax_amount IS NOT NULL ORDER BY e.employee_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM PayrollData WHERE employee_id = 101;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM Employee WHERE position = 'Manager';
SELECT department_name FROM Department ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT SUM(total_pay) AS total_payroll FROM WageRecord WHERE pay_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT start_date, end_date, type FROM TimeOff WHERE employee_id = 201 ORDER BY start_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM PayrollData JOIN Employee ON PayrollData.employee_id = Employee.employee_id;
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date, position FROM Employee WHERE position = 'Manager';
SELECT department_id, department_name FROM Department WHERE department_name LIKE 'H%';
SELECT employee_id, hours_worked, hourly_rate, total_pay FROM PayrollData WHERE hours_worked > 40 ORDER BY total_pay DESC;

SELECT Employee.first_name, Employee.last_name, TimeOff.type, TimeOff.start_date, TimeOff.end_date FROM Employee JOIN TimeOff ON Employee.employee_id = TimeOff.employee_id WHERE TimeOff.type = 'Vacation';
